result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny Douglas Mitchell II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Danny Douglas Mitchell II is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Danny Douglas Mitchell II was found guilty of Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).
  • Danny Douglas Mitchell II was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Death) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony, Penalty-Contribute/Delinquency(Death)], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid at rate of 25% of prison wages until release.  Balance to be paid during extended supervision as arranged by the agent.
Defendant shall undergo and complete AODA treatment and counseling.

NO CONTACT WITH minors.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.

Submit DNA sample if not already completed.
Continued participation and completion of Sex Offender Treatment.
Maintain compliance with the Sex Offender Registry.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Dept of Corrections/Agent.

John k Smerlinski appearing by phone on behalf of defendant.
Danny Douglas Mitchell, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen & Jeff Kohl appearing as prosecuting attorney.
Atty Smerlinski presented his order from the last hearing.  ADA Kohl has to prepare and present his order from the last hearing.  No obj to Atty Smerlinski's order, Judge signs.
Jury instructions to file by Dec 1, 2016 at noon.  DE Atty to contact DA by 12/1 at noon as to status of whether offer is accepted. of Subpoena-Kris Hasse

Danny Douglas Mitchell, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Case called at 2:09 p.m.  Trial is still calendared.  Atty S - GC DA has made an acceptable offer, but disposition of this case is encumbent on a case in another county.
Court addresses motions to -  Suppress stmts, to compel interviews, DEs records of convictions.  Atty S stipulates and withdraws motion to suppress statements.  Parties address and review with the court all motions and motions in limine filed by the State and Defense.  Atty Smerlinski has been given assurance that witness will not be doing oral narrative nor written summary to the jury.  Court confirms ruling that no evidence as to motion to compel interview records exists.  Parties agree as to DEs dress and security.  #8 - open at trial.  #9 - Court to address and rule as photos are introduced.  DE convictions at 8 and parties to inform other witnesses as to conviction testimony.  #19b - not allowed by stipulation.  #20 held open.  Other acts - #2 is not admissable.  #3 DA to instruct witnesses.  #10 is out.  #12 open at trial.  Numerous boiler plate items can be timely raised by the parties at trial for the court to rule.  State has moved to allow AIT testimony by video and Atty Smerlinski cannot yet agree to that.  BREAK at 2:50 p.m.  Case reconvenes at 3:02 p.m.  Set for telephone status Nov 28, 2016 at 3:15 p.m.
Court requests these stipulations and rulings from today be submitted in writing by respective parties.
